p: The microbial composition of the colonic digesta following the H. illucens larvae treatment was revealed by 16S rRNA Illumina MiSeq sequencing. In the present study, a total of 1,031,156 V3-V4 16S rRNA effective sequences from the 24 samples, with an average 42,954 sequences per sample, were used for subsequent analysis. The flattened rarefaction curves showed that the sampling in each group provided sufficient OTU coverage (Additional file 3: Figure S1). No significant differences in species richness (as reflected by the ACE and Chao1 indices) or diversity (as reflected by Shannon and Simpson indices) were observed in the colonic digesta bacteria at the taxonomic level (Fig. 1a). However, the PCoA with the Bray−Curtis distance results showed that the H1 group was separated from the control group (Fig. 1b). AMOVA analysis also showed significant dissimilarities between the H1 and control groups ( Fs = 2.25, P < 0.01, among control, H1, and H2 groups; Fs = 1.63, P < 0.05, H1 vs. H2; Fs = 3.45, P < 0.001, control vs. H1; Fs = 1.61, P = 0.069, control vs. H2).
